title: How to Drink to Cure the Hiccups

steps.title: Fill a glass with water.
steps.content: Fill a glass with water.

steps.title: Bend over until you are as upside down as possible, then drink the water.
steps.content: Bend over until you are as upside down as possible, then drink the water.

steps.title: Don't stop to breathe!
steps.content: Don't stop to breathe! That should cure your hiccups.

steps.title: Get a 12 ounce glass of water.
steps.content: Get a 12 ounce glass of water.

steps.title: Hold your nose shut by pinching the sides with your fingers.
steps.content: Hold your nose shut by pinching the sides with your fingers.

steps.title: Drink as much water as you can as fast as you can.
steps.content: Drink as much water as you can as fast as you can. You should feel your ears pop slightly.

steps.title: Repeat the steps, if necessary.
steps.content: Repeat the steps, if necessary.

steps.title: Get a small glass of water.
steps.content: Get a small glass of water.

steps.title: Take a sip of water but do not swallow it.
steps.content: Take a sip of water but do not swallow it.

steps.title: Tilt your head back as far as possible and swallow the water.
steps.content: Tilt your head back as far as possible and swallow the water. It's harder than drinking normally, but your hiccups should be gone.

steps.title: Fill a glass of water to the brim.
steps.content: Fill a glass of water to the brim.

steps.title: With your thumbs, plug your ears.
steps.content: With your thumbs, plug your ears.

steps.title: With your index fingers, plug your nostrils (squeeze to close).
steps.content: With your index fingers, plug your nostrils (squeeze to close).

steps.title: With both ears and nostrils plugged, use your remaining free fingers to grasp the glass and raise it to your mouth.
steps.content: With both ears and nostrils plugged, use your remaining free fingers to grasp the glass and raise it to your mouth.

steps.title: Finish the entire glass of water without releasing your ears or your nostrils.
steps.content: Finish the entire glass of water without releasing your ears or your nostrils.

steps.title: Fill two tall 12 oz.
steps.content: Fill two tall 12 oz. glasses with cool water and set them on a table in front of you. The second glass is for just in case you finish the first one, if you really need it.

steps.title: Close your eyes and settle yourself.
steps.content: Close your eyes and settle yourself. Confidence and positive thinking are important here, so chill out and loosen up.

steps.title: Pick up the first glass and wait for a hiccup.
steps.content: Pick up the first glass and wait for a hiccup. Just after it hits, begin drinking slowly, steadily and continuously until the glass is empty.

steps.title: Try not to think about hiccuping as you set the empty glass down.
steps.content: Try not to think about hiccuping as you set the empty glass down. Hopefully you will have interrupted the rhythm of the hiccups, but if not then you will have to go to the second glass and repeat the process.

steps.title: Drink the second glass of water, slow and steadily, and do your best to remain calm and relaxed.
steps.content: Drink the second glass of water, slow and steadily, and do your best to remain calm and relaxed. By the time you've finished, the hiccups should be gone.

steps.title: Fill a glass with cool drinking water.
steps.content: Fill a glass with cool drinking water.

steps.title: Get a clean paper towel.
steps.content: Get a clean paper towel. (If you have no paper towels, a thin cloth will work.)

steps.title: Cover the top of the glass with the paper towel.
steps.content: Cover the top of the glass with the paper towel. Fold down the edges of the paper towel to completely wrap the top of the glass. Hold the paper towel in place by grasping the glass in your hand.

steps.title: Drink a sip of water through the paper towel.
steps.content: Drink a sip of water through the paper towel.

steps.title: One sip is often enough; if not, take a few more sips.
steps.content: One sip is often enough; if not, take a few more sips.

steps.title: Fill a glass to the brim with room temperature water.
steps.content: Fill a glass to the brim with room temperature water.

steps.title: Slowly drink the entire glass of water by taking very small quick sips.
steps.content: Slowly drink the entire glass of water by taking very small quick sips. Don't chug the water and do not remove the glass from your mouth. You should be continuously swallowing small sips of water.

steps.title: Once you finish the water, take long, slow breaths and try to relax; your hiccups should be gone.
steps.content: Once you finish the water, take long, slow breaths and try to relax; your hiccups should be gone.

steps.title: Fill a drinking glass with room temperature water.
steps.content: Fill a drinking glass with room temperature water.

steps.title: With glass in hand, bend over at your waist.
steps.content: With glass in hand, bend over at your waist.

steps.title: Place your lips on the side of the glass opposite that from which you would normally drink.
steps.content: Place your lips on the side of the glass opposite that from which you would normally drink. Your bottom lip should be above the lip of the glass where your top lip would normally be, and your top lip should be against the side of the glass against the edge where your bottom lip would normally be.

steps.title: Carefully tip the glass away from you and into your mouth.
steps.content: Carefully tip the glass away from you and into your mouth.

steps.title: Swallow and repeat.
steps.content: Swallow and repeat. Your hiccups should be gone.

steps.title: Get a bottle of water.
steps.content: Get a bottle of water.

steps.title: Instead of drinking normally, drink with your bottom lip in the lower portion of the opening and your top lip over the top.
steps.content: Instead of drinking normally, drink with your bottom lip in the lower portion of the opening and your top lip over the top. You develop a "vacuum" to keep from spilling or pouring it down your shirt. It doesn't take much; just a sip or two will work.

steps.title: Start with a small glass of water (about 4 ounces).
steps.content: Start with a small glass of water (about 4 ounces).

steps.title: Put in about half as much crushed ice as you have water.
steps.content: Put in about half as much crushed ice as you have water. Make sure that the ice bits are smaller than a pea, or choking may result!

steps.title: Drink the water slowly, swallowing the ice bits along with the water.
steps.content: Drink the water slowly, swallowing the ice bits along with the water. If you encounter large pieces of ice, chew so that they break into pea-sized segments and swallow.

steps.title: Take deep breaths in between sips.
steps.content: Take deep breaths in between sips. Inhale and exhale, making sure that the air goes into your lungs, so your cheeks shouldn't "puff up" and fill with air. Your hiccups should be gone after you finish drinking.

steps.title: If that does not work, repeat the above method.
steps.content: If that does not work, repeat the above method. But, this time, put in 2 tablespoons of sugar.

steps.title: Pour about a medium glass of water into a cup.
steps.content: Pour about a medium glass of water into a cup.

steps.title: Put a metal spoon in the glass with the handle side sticking out.
steps.content: Put a metal spoon in the glass with the handle side sticking out. The handle must be out of water.

steps.title: Tilt the cup toward your lips like you're about to take a sip.
steps.content: Tilt the cup toward your lips like you're about to take a sip.

steps.title: Make sure the spoon handle is pressing against the area between your eye brows.
steps.content: Make sure the spoon handle is pressing against the area between your eye brows.

steps.title: Take a few sips of water while the spoon is pressing against the area between your eyebrows, and your hiccups will be gone!
steps.content: Take a few sips of water while the spoon is pressing against the area between your eyebrows, and your hiccups will be gone!

steps.title: Get a glass of water.
steps.content: Get a glass of water.

steps.title: Take a sip standing upright, but don't swallow.
steps.content: Take a sip standing upright, but don't swallow.

steps.title: Turn your head upside down and swallow slowly.
steps.content: Turn your head upside down and swallow slowly.

steps.title: Get a partner and a cup filled with water.
steps.content: Get a partner and a cup filled with water.

steps.title: Stand facing the partner, bent forward at the waist.
steps.content: Stand facing the partner, bent forward at the waist.

steps.title: Have your partner tilt the cup to your lips, and drink.
steps.content: Have your partner tilt the cup to your lips, and drink.

steps.title: Get a cup filled with a non-carbonated beverage of your choice and a straw.
steps.content: Get a cup filled with a non-carbonated beverage of your choice and a straw.

steps.title: Take a deep breath
steps.content: Take a deep breath and hold it. Pinch your nostrils with one hand.

steps.title: With the other hand, raise the cup to your mouth and swallow as much as you can through the straw while holding your breath.
steps.content: With the other hand, raise the cup to your mouth and swallow as much as you can through the straw while holding your breath.

steps.title: Get any size glass of water.
steps.content: Get any size glass of water.

steps.title: Start to stand on your right leg.
steps.content: Start to stand on your right leg. While doing that, put your left thumb in your left ear.

steps.title: Drink the water until your hiccups are gone.
steps.content: Drink the water until your hiccups are gone.

steps.title: Hold your breath.
steps.content: Hold your breath.

steps.title: Take 5-10 sips of water.
steps.content: Take 5-10 sips of water. (Be careful, start small if you have a hard time holding your breath for awhile.)

steps.title: Exhale slowly.
steps.content: Exhale slowly.
